review_title: When will you get paid, well... could be a wile
job_title: Adjunct Professor in Norfolk, VA
pros: I love the department I work with. The other professors are really nice and helpful.  This is my second semester with them.
cons: The pay is low. That is pretty true across the board  for adjunct professors though. What the biggest problem is no one knows / can tell you when you will get your first paycheck of the semester. The fall semester my first paycheck came pretty quickly. This semester it took me 6 WEEKS to get my first paycheck. It is very disheartening to put the effort into teaching students and being uncertain when you will get paid.  I would only recommend working here if you have enough savings / other income to live for a month or two with no payment.

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Norfolk, VA
pros: The materials science and engineering program here within the center for materials research is great overall. I have had an awesome experience. The equipment and facilities are top notch and through IGERT (an NSF funded traineeship) I have had a good stipend. Lots of opportunities to go on conference and present at competitions.
cons: A lot of politics sometimes. The administration doesn't always communicate very well and often is not transparent. The transition from the master to phd program is pretty rigorous with both written and oral qualifying exams.

job_title: Information Technology Specialist III in Norfolk, VA
pros: Norfolk State University (NSU) is a great place to work, they have a family atmosphere that not only nurtures its students, but its employees.  They provide excellent benefits and many opportunities to use all of your talents.  Norfolk is a great location (close to attractions), the surrounding cities have wonderful public k-12 school systems and affordable housing.
cons: Parking on campus is a bit of a hassle.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Norfolk State University is a family environment and I love working with the students. I went to school and I was a part of Norfolk State University growth.
cons: I'm currently part-time and I am seeking a full-time position. I am seeking a full-time position because I need benefits.

job_title: Biology Laboratory Assistant in Norfolk, VA
pros: Worked with a group of ten student in range from upcoming freshmen in high school to entering freshmen in college, learning Arabic, microbiology skill set (pipetting, cultures, solving the mystery of "who done it") finger printing analysis and researching the country of Pakistan on the water quality in the lakes rivers and ocean to that of Virginia (tidewater region).
cons: It was a short summer program.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Norfolk, VA

cons: Athletic department is poorly run and lacks leadership from the top.  Disgruntles employees and perpetuates down the chain.  Good employees are not respected and paid fairly while ineffective employees are kept on for years and paid better.
